My Portfolio

Take a look at some of my work!

Clear View Escapes

Fictional travel business - website

This is a fully responsive and interactive single page website created using Html, SCSS, and JavaScript. The SCSS is written to incorporate BEM methodology: taking advantage of reusable and scalable code. The site is built together with GulpJS and Webpack, utilizing Babel to transpile modern Es6 JavaScript.

View project View code

Jammming

Spotify clone - web application

This is a single page web application built using React. The application utilizes the Spotify API and the JavaScript Fetch API to allow users to login to their accounts using OAuth. The users can then search for songs, build playlists, and then add them to be saved to their Spotify accounts.

View project View code

Catch Of The Day

Fictional Seafood Store - web application

This is a single page CRUD (Create, Read, Update, Delete) stack web application built using React. This project makes use of features such as React router for page handling, prop types for resiliency, CSSTransitions, and Firebase for data storage and account authentication.

View project View code

Colmar Academy

Fictional University - website

This website was built from a design mockup with HTML and CSS. It is a static page built with an emphasis on layout and ARIA accessibility attributes. Media queries are used to ensure a beautiful experience on all screen sizes.

View project View code

Ravenous

Yelp clone - web application

This is a web application built with React. It utilizes the fetch API to retrieve data from the Yelp API. The user is able to search a restaurant or style of food in any city. They can then filter these searches through 'Best Match', 'Highest Rated', and 'Most Reviewed.' The results are then returned containing basic information about the restaurant as well as their rating.

View project View code

Game Of Life

Interactive game - web application

The Game Of Life is a non-interactive game built using React. This game focuses on JavaScript logic. The game sets a few rules: squares are first populated with color and when the game starts, squares are filled or emptied based on their location to other squares. The game is scalable with multiple grid sizes and feature buttons for control over simple aspects of the game.

View project View code
